snippet: Warplanes attacked militant bases and depots, according to French officials, as secular Tuareg rebels said they had captured two Islamist commanders near the Algerian border.
abstract: French warplanes bomb Islamist militant bases and depots deep into northern Mali to disrupt their supply routes as secular Tuareg rebels announce they have captured two Islamist commanders near Algerian border.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and SCOTT SAYARE

lead_paragraph: Warplanes attacked militant bases and depots, according to French officials, as secular Tuareg rebels said they had captured two Islamist commanders near the Algerian border.

headline.seo: Mali Rebels, Now Aiding French, Say They’re Holding Militants
headline.main: Mali Rebels, Now Aiding French, Say They’re Holding Militants
headline.print_headline: Mali Rebels, Now Aiding French, Say They’re Holding Militants
